thread.title: Hillsborough and Pinellas among leading U.S. counties in hotel job growth
thread.title_full: Hillsborough and Pinellas among leading U.S. counties in hotel job growth

author: Eric Snider
title: Hillsborough and Pinellas among leading U.S. counties in hotel job growth
text:
Hillsborough and Pinellas among leading U.S. counties in hotel job growth Jul 29, 2015, 2:29pm EDT Industries & Tags Eric Snider Reporter Tampa Bay Business Journal Eric Snider Reporter Tampa Bay Business Journal Hotel reception with bell Hillsborough and Pinellas counties ranked in the Top 5 for hotel job growth during 2014. A new report by Austin, Texas-based Headlight Data shows that among 50 tourist-heavy counties in the U.S., Hillsborough ranked second with a growth rate of 6.12 percent; Pinellas came in fourth at 5.7 percent. The survey, culled from the federal Bureau of Labor Statistics data, looked at salaried hotel workers. Hillsborough County had 6,170 salaried employees working directly for hotels in 2014 compared to 5,813 the previous year, according to Headlight Data. Both counties have been smashing monthly bed tax records for more than a year. Davidson County (Nashville), Tennessee led the nation in hotel job growth with a 6.7 percent gain. Orange County (Orlando) placed 10th, with a 4.5 percent boost. The Headlight study also cited the poorest-performing markets. Atlantic County (Atlantic City), New Jersey, whose woes have been well-documented , dropped 13.4 percent of its hotel jobs in â€™14. Horry County (Myrtle Beach), South Carolina dipped 12.8 percent. San Francisco County, California trimmed 2.2 percent, slightly less than that of King County (Seattle), Washington at 2.3 percent. One California scenario stood out. While Los Angeles County ranked No. 5 in job growth with 5.5 percent, adjacent Orange County to the south came in fourth in job loss with 2.4 percent. No Florida counties were part of the bottom 10. 
Want Tampa Bay Travel
